question: My husband is 33 with type 1 diabetes.  8 months ago he had a severe two week bout  of nausea and vomiting which ended up being diagnosed through a GET test as gastroparesis.  Since then he has been in and out of the hospital almost weekly with severe dehydration, vomiting, nausea and gastric pain.  He can barely go a day without several bouts of vomiting.  He has been followed by a gastroenterologist and his PCP and they seem to have no solutions for him other than Zofran, Reglan, and erythromycin, which obviously are not working.  His blood sugars have been in the 140-150 range and he is following a meal plan with 6 small, low fat, low fiber meals. His doctor does not reccomend any type of surgical intervention.  Is there any hope??
title: Gastroparesis--HELP!
